page.title: 01Marton & Birdingbury 1985.
page.content: This block is an example of a rural area in the midlands.Most of the land is intensely farmed for arable crops.The farms are a moderate size,the one we visited being 200 acres.The farming is highly mechanised.Within the square lie two small villages.These have swollen during the last 20 years but their growth has been controlled by the green belt area.We have tried to look at the area in terms of:are the villages self-sufficient or have they become residential areas for the wealthy labour forces of Rugby, Coventry and Leamington?To this end we have looked closely at the village shops,the village pubs, transport housing and leisure activities of the population.Unfortunately our conclusions are that "the village" no longer exists.
